planets.name: Mercury
planets.atmosphere: Very thin (oxygen, sodium, hydrogen, helium, potassium)
planets.description: Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system and the closest to the Sun. It has extreme temperature variations and no atmosphere to speak of.
interesting_facts: One day on Mercury lasts about 59 Earth days
Mercury has no seasons because its axis is not tilted
It's the second densest planet after Earth

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is the second planet from the Sun and the hottest planet in our solar system due to its thick atmosphere and greenhouse effect.
key_features: Hottest planet in the solar system
interesting_facts: Venus rotates backwards compared to most planets
A day on Venus is longer than its year
Surface pressure is 90 times that of Earth

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only known planet to harbor life. It has liquid water, a protective atmosphere, and a suitable temperature range.
interesting_facts: 71% of Earth's surface is covered by water
Earth's magnetic field protects us from solar radiation
The only planet not named after a Roman or Greek god

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun, known as the Red Planet due to iron oxide on its surface. It has the largest volcano and canyon in the solar system.
interesting_facts: Mars has the largest dust storms in the solar system
A day on Mars is very similar to Earth (24.6 hours)
Mars has two small moons: Phobos and Deimos

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.atmosphere: 89% hydrogen, 10% helium, traces of methane, water, ammonia
planets.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system, a gas giant with a Great Red Spot storm and dozens of moons including the four largest: Io, Europa, Ganymede, and Callisto.
key_features: Largest planet in the solar system
interesting_facts: Jupiter could fit all other planets inside it
It acts as a 'cosmic vacuum cleaner' protecting inner planets
The Great Red Spot is a storm larger than Earth

planets.name: Saturn
planets.atmosphere: 96% hydrogen, 3% helium, traces of methane and ammonia
planets.description: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun, famous for its spectacular ring system. It's a gas giant with many moons, including Titan which has a thick atmosphere.
interesting_facts: Saturn would float in water if there was a bathtub big enough
Its rings are made mostly of ice particles
Titan is larger than Mercury

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun, an ice giant that rotates on its side. It has a faint ring system and 27 known moons.
key_features: Rotates on its side (98° axial tilt)
Made of water, methane, and ammonia ices
interesting_facts: Uranus rotates on its side, possibly due to an ancient collision
It has seasons that last 21 Earth years each
Its rings were discovered in 1977

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the eighth and outermost planet in our solar system. It's an ice giant with the fastest winds in the solar system and a large moon called Triton.
interesting_facts: Neptune has the fastest winds in the solar system
It was the first planet discovered through mathematical prediction
Triton is likely a captured Kuiper Belt object
